definition.name: Permutations_h1_h2_h3
definition.definition:
The permutations h₁, h₂, h₃ ∈ Sym(Ω) are defined as 4-cycles:

h₁ := (1 6 4 3) — meaning h₁(1)=6, h₁(6)=4, h₁(4)=3, h₁(3)=1, with h₁(2)=2, h₁(5)=5 fixed
h₂ := (1 2 4 5) — meaning h₂(1)=2, h₂(2)=4, h₂(4)=5, h₂(5)=1, with h₂(3)=3, h₂(6)=6 fixed
h₃ := (5 6 2 3) — meaning h₃(5)=6, h₃(6)=2, h₃(2)=3, h₃(3)=5, with h₃(1)=1, h₃(4)=4 fixed

Each hᵢ is a 4-cycle of order 4. They are elements of S₆ = Sym({1,2,3,4,5,6}).
